Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Chofch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and is excellent value for money. Staff were helpful and courteous. Rooms do vary in size, but ours were fine. No problem with the bathrooms or showers, except that there were no shelves or hooks to put toiletries etc on. Would definitely recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Julie0806
Reviews.Content: Location was fabulous 3 mins to San Marco and 4 mins to Rialto, perfecto. Do agree it was hard to find at first, loved the challenge of finding our way home at night after a bottle of Chanti ! The hotel is modern in it's amenities, but very authentic Italian in decor. Very clean, couldn't believe getting fresh towels and bed linen 3 days running (our stay was only 3days). Breakfast was continental, but fresh. The dining room is too small, and gets very crowded. Mario, on reception, was a real treasure, speaks beautiful english and is very helpful and funny. Beds were a bit soft but slept ok. Had room on the front and its a bit noisy in the morning, but thats Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, good location”
Reviews.Author: cepi44
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there 3 nights in march, great location, 5 minutes walking from Plaza San Marco, for some reason in Google maps it tells you it is before the little bridge, but is not, just cross the bridge and walk just a little bit and it will be in your right hand side, really small entrance but they have a sign there that you will see after the bridge. We got a room with a window facing fabbri street, so you can hear everything going on there, like in the morning when they are opening all the business places (metal doors rolling up), but I kind of like that, that way you have an early start and enjoy Venice. Even if you have a map of Venice you will get lost half the time, so we just put the map away and walk on! ( and so did most the people there!) its nice just to get lost and keep on walking cause anywhere you go is nice.. The guy on the reception was Mario, he speaks English, Spanish, french,and 3 other languages. Breakfast included witch is the same stuff in all the hotels in Italy, coffee, juice, different types of bread, cereals, milk, ham, cheese, salami, fruit etc. The only thing we didn't like much was the shower that its on a bath tub with no liner, so you get water all over but just use the extra towels for the floor and you are fine, you will get fresh towels everyday, at least is better then Paris were the shower was just a bathtub with no liner and no shower head! remember you are in Europe. And yes, anywhere in Italy you would have to pay the "tax" in every hotel for each day, I think it was about 3 euros a night there, 10 euros in Florence, and I think 2 euros in Pisa at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: rkd29ny
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel was great. Walking distance from most all the tourist sites. Hotel was difficult to find from the directions on the website, having a street map would have been helpful. Definitely a budget hotel, but decor of the room had a nice antique feel. Room was clean but whole hotel did have a swampy smell (although this is a common problem in many places throughout Venice). Room was small but spacious enough, shower is non-enclosed. Breakfast was not the greatest. Staff did not go out of the way to be friendly but were helpful when asked.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ez-n-frank
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located roughly half way between Rialto Bridge and St. Marks square on one of the main thoroughfares and in terms of location is very well placed. Check in was fairly straightforward although they insisted on taking our passports off us which is something I always hate. The room was pretty much as per the website, they do look rather dated but on closer inspection I think they have been done in the last few years, that's just the style of them. The room had all you'd expect for this type of hotel - TV, safe, hairdryer etc. The bed was comfy but the aircon was playing up so it was a little too hot for me to sleep properly. Breakfast was a continental affair and fairly average, the usual meats, cheese, bread, cereal etc. I only have a couple of minor gripes about the hotel, first was the weird waiting area on the 2nd floor which seemed to attract people congregating on a night causing noise - quite why they didn't put an extra room there instead is beyond me. Second was the faulty aircon which could not be turned off heating mode. Overall though, a good hotel, well worth what we paid and in a fantastic location for exploring the city. Word of warning - the hotel is apparently obliged to charge you a tourist tax 9as are all hotels in Venice, or so I'm told). it's only a few Euros so just make sure you have a little extra spare.

Reviews.Title: “very bad !”
Reviews.Author: sofrod
Reviews.Content: Booked thru an online site but mistaken the arrival date. They did not care at all helping me change the date 3 days before my arrival simply sitting on the contract with the online site. They even told me that the online service would not allow this change, however the customer service of the online website didn't have any problem (they even contacted the hotel for me). Finally they charged me normally even if I didn't go! They should be ashamed!

Reviews.Title: “Basic and satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: YoungArius
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Room well decorated and very warm, which was appreciated considering it was freezing outside. Breakfast wasn't great and it's a shame the hotel didn't have a bar or place where you could take coffee at any other time. Staff ranged from very helpful to grumpy. All in all, for a 3 star hotel, can't really complain

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Simon L
Reviews.Content: The hotel was small but the room was a good size- making it perfect for a city break. Breakfast was provided in a buffet style european breakfast room- the food was great. The hotel was easily findable from the nearest canal taxi stop and was a 5-10 minute leisurely walk from St Mark's Basilica and Square. Overall an excellent base for a 3 day trip to the city. I had little contact with the staff over such a short trip but the room was cleaned everyday and the cleaners seemed efficient. The staff on the desk in the reception were very pleased to help and gave concise directions in excellently spoken english!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth what you pay”
Reviews.Author: ConorJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, just off San Marco square. The staff are very friendly and as helpful as you will get in Italy. The breakfast here is pretty average, standard Italian dry bread, cheese and ham. We had a problem with receiving wifi in our room on the first night (we stayed 2 nights) and when I went to reception to complain, I was met with the hands in the air "I know nothing" blank stare. Despite this, the rooms are warm (in October) if a little dated. There is a good range of various language TV channels, a decent mini bar, and good room service. There is no bar in this hotel, however, the staff helpfulness made up for this. The restaurant manager (lady) and breakfast waitress deserve special mention for their assistance. For value, stay here. If you want a high standard of accomodation and food, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Below average, not worth 3-star”
Reviews.Author: myi4u
Reviews.Content: This hotel came up as the cheapest in the list and being 3-star, I thought it should be alright. Its nearest boat station is called Rialto and most tourist attractions are within walking distance; Piazza San Marco and Rialto Bridge. The room is spacious. I thought the small TV is placed a bit too high. Everything looked and felt antique. The shower is divided from the rest of the bathroom with two panes; which I believe the purpose of the panes is to prevent the water from pouring over the toilet bowl and the basin. Nevertheless, it doesnâ€™t prevent the water from covering the whole bathroom floor. The hair dryer connector fell off easily. The roomâ€™s DOOR KNOB can be easily unscrewed. It didnâ€™t worry my wife and me too much because the room we were in is near the reception and we didnâ€™t place any valuable stuff in the room when we were out. One of the windows almost fell off when opened as the top bit was not connected. We decided to keep it close anyway since itâ€™s not really that hot and we had other windows to use. Breakfast was alright. Coffee was weird. Staffs were OK. On our final day, we left our luggage at the reception. When we went back to collect our luggage, we just took it with us and the receptionist didnâ€™t even care to check. Think twice before leaving your luggage with them. As for WiFi, we did manage to scan and connect to HotelGorizia. It didnâ€™tâ€™ require any password, so we never asked the hotel if they offer any free WiFi. Itâ€™s rated as 3-star but I think itâ€™s only worth 1-star. No WiFi, unsecure room, broken equipment, smelly corridor, below average breakfast and no map. I know most people buy Venice map but I thought map should be free.

Reviews.Title: “no heat”
Reviews.Author: dizie36417
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice on October 15 and stayed at this hotel for two nights. The temperatures were in the 40's (f) both nights but did warm up to the high 50's during the day. If you sat in the sun it was merely comfortable. Now for the hotel---no heat. We asked over and over could we please have heat . The response was NO cannot turn on the heat and then expect the the patrons to ask for air the following week. Can you believe! We needed to go across the street to another hotel to warm up. Their heat was on. The breakfast room is tight. You cannot leave your seat unless your neightbor behind you gets up for coffee or to leave their seat. Tight corridors, for sure. For the outrageous fee for this hotel-----no heat and uncomfortably small---------look elsewhere. diane

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Mnanne
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in one awesome location! Right between Rialto and St. MArk's square, so if you are spending a night, its the best time to visit St. Mark's square late when all the other tourists who do not live close by have left - and that IS the best time to see it! The hotel rooms are done very well. However, stay here if you are not too fussy. The AC gave trouble both night, the fridge in the room didn't work and the bath shower enclosure really didn't contain any of the water. There is no free wi-fi which the rest of the Italian hotels offer and the internet rates are very high. But the place was clean and we got a back facing room which was quiet. The breakfast was quite good and had a reasonable spread. Ofcourse we had one resident shouting loudly to the waitress for "americano coffee and fried eggs" ...really, come on now... you're in Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Average Hotel - but for Venice standards not bad”
Reviews.Author: ZAExplorer
Reviews.Content: Ranked against our previous trips to Venice this hotel still ranks as very average. 220 Euros for one night. (Although Graspo de Ua is worse) We stayed in 115 (and the second couple in 116), 115 is the handicapped room (we never chose it - it was allocated to us), which meant that the bathroom was quite big and it had 2 louver shower doors that closed to make a shower. Probably one of worst bathrooms we have experienced, dangerous when wet. Rooms are old and a bit tired. Bedroom was ok but beds are VERY hard. That said, staff were friendly and helpful - they arranged a water taxi for 5am in the morning within 5 minutes (120 Euros!) Bonus of hotel is that it is very central - +- 150 metre walk to San Marco Square which is nice. For the price (in Venice) not bad.... but would try another one next time. maybe Best Western

Reviews.Title: “Over-priced, would be half the price elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: 110311name
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Gorizia in the Venice train station agency, which cost us 3 Euros fee, when on previous visits this service was free. One more tourist rip-off. We thought we would get a really good hotel for the price,( 187 Euros per night). Forget it. The hotel was no better than those at half the price in other locations. It was OK but not worth the cost. The coffee at breakfast was foul, coming from a machine that needed attention to get rid of the tainting of the flavour. I rate the hotel poorly on account of its average service at inflated prices. BE WARNED WHEN BOOKING HOTELS IN VENICE THAT YOU WILL, SINCE AUGUST 2011, BE CHARGED A CITY TOURIST TAX OF THREE EUROS PER PERSON, PER NIGHT, ON TOP OF THE HUGELY INFLATED HOTEL COSTS. This, with the booking fee, cost us an extra 27 Euros. This government greed is in spite of the fact that Venice rakes in hundreds of millions from tourists already every year, who save the city from falling into ruin. It also gets millions from other funds. When will the authorities stop ripping-off the tourists? I recommend visitors stay outside Venice and go in on the excellent train or boat services as day visitors, which cost a few Euros. You will save hundreds of Euros.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: edpurs999
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, ideally situated for exploring Venice. If you get the boat from the airport, and get off at the Rialto, you can walk to the hotel, no need for a porter as it is very close. The hotel is small but comfortable and the room was nice enough. There is a lift in the hotel, the rooms have fridges, and the buffet breakfast was good. The staff were pleasant. I didn't use the internet,but there was a wifi connection through a commercial operator. In general then it is a nice hotel in a very very expensive city. The recently introduced tourist tax is 3 euro per person per night in this hotel (I think it varies); the boat from the airport was 25 euro return.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad deal”
Reviews.Author: notsohappyDenver
Reviews.Content: Nice location in the middle of everything. Walking distance to many of Venice attractions. Breakfast area was cozy. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms are small, old, but it is clean and cozy

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located near the heart of Venice....”
Reviews.Author: djnstudios
Reviews.Content: We ended up at this hotel by chance. Our other arrangements fell through and we ended up scrambling to find a new place to stay during our time in Venice. We REALLY lucked out. Gorizia is located about halfway between the Rialto Bridge and Piazza San Marco. Which made it really easy to see those spots as well as pretty much anything around them. The really nice thing about the location of this hotel is that it's pretty close to water bus (#1 bus I believe) and there is only one small bridge to go over. If you are familiar with Venice's layout, only having to cross one small bridge (if you take the water bus to the Rialto stop) is a huge plus. Getting all of our luggage to the hotel was really easy. Most of the hotels that are more accessible are far more expensive. My group was about 8 people, and each member of our party was happy with the accommodations. We were traveling to get to my wedding so we had a mix of friends and family which included a big age range and everyone was easily accommodated at the hotel. Ease of access was good and there was a small elevator (not always a guarantee in Venice) which helped my people get their bags to their rooms. The air conditioning was strong and easy to control, which was great because it was HOT when we were passing through. The hotel itself was clean and quiet. The rooms were a comfortable size, mine included a "daybed" that was the size of a couch as well as a queen sized bed for my fiancÃ© and I. There was plenty of room for our bags and to have a guest or two sit and relax. The shower had great pressure and there was plenty of hot water. There weren't an fancy frills but, the room provided great comfort after a long flight. The people working the front desk were very helpful for answering questions or giving directions. Most spoke enough english to help the non-italian speakers in the group. The breakfast room was fairly small but there was plenty of food for everyone, as they came in waves. The bacon was very good, the eggs were mediocre (as European eggs tend to be) there was plentiful pastries, cereal, fruits and yogurts. Overall, the hotel was a great deal and a comfortable stay. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: EuropeWanderlust
Reviews.Content: Hi, This hotel is located at very very close proximity to St Marks Square.This offers opportunity for a late night scroll into the city centre and the piazza and to soak in the beauty of the waters at night. The decor isn't that great. Would recommend it to anyone wanting to spend most of their out on the streets and use the room for crashing at night. The breakfast is not that bad. Venice is a beautiful city and I loved every minute of my stay there. Blog on my magical trip to Venice: http://europe-trotter.blogspot.com/2011/07/veneziaaaa.html

Reviews.Title: “Adequate accommodation, very good location”
Reviews.Author: canmark
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Gorizia a la Valigia, is a small, older, European-style hotel located on the Calle Fabbri in the San Marco sestiere of Venice. The building, lobby and rooms are rather unprepossessing, but the staff was not unpleasant, the complimentary Continental breakfast was better than expected, and the location is very good (mid-way between the Piazza San Marco and the Rialto bridge). Rooms are all different and offer a variety of quirks. Others in our group had a room with a tiny shower which drained into the bathroom--leaving the floor wet. My room was on the 4th floor triple room (the elevator only went to the 3rd floor). The shower was small, but the bathroom was big--however the ceiling sloped sharply downward (it was the roof, presumably), making half the bathroom space unusable. That said, the hotel was not unpleasant, there was plenty of food provided for breakfast (juices and coffee, cereal, yogurt, meats and cheeses, pastries and breads), and the hotel itself was quite quiet, yet well located.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the website”
Reviews.Author: cpsteward
Reviews.Content: This hotel's website oversells the property. We stayed in a 'superior' room for one night. The room was comfortable enough, but small and not worth the 185 euros we paid for it. The bathroom was tiny - hardly room to turn around. The shower ceiling was stained and covered in mould, there were tiles missing from around the door frame and the fittings looked like they had been there since the 1970s. The fan in the bathroom made a loud 'clunking' noise'. The staff were surly and unwelcoming and the communal areas of the hotel are scruffy, with worn carpet, scuffed paintwork etc. The only good thing about the hotel is its location - just a few minutes walk from the Piazza San Marco. For better value I would recommend the UNA Venezia, which we stayed in just a week before - excellent room and a cheaper rate than this hotel. It's a few more minutes walk from the city centre, but that means its quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location.”
Reviews.Author: Debs5011
Reviews.Content: We came off the vaporetti at the Rialto Bridge but it is easy to find the hotel from San Maco square. My mother and I found the staff polite and all seemed to speak very good English. Our room was clean and the beds comfortable it was handy having a fridge and safe in the room. Couldnt fault the breakfast, cereal, fruit, yogurt, meat, cheese etc and as many bread rolls and tea and coffee as you could want. There are a few negatives though the hair dryers are not any good it would take you a week to dry your hair! Our air conditioner didnt work and so we had to have the windows open so the noise was quite bad but I bought ear plugs and you expect it to be noisy thats what you get for such a fantastic location. Teatto La Fenice and the Doge's palace are musts to visit. Try and find time to take in some shows, we went to Venezia at Teatro San Gallo which is near San Marco, and we went to9 a Vivaldi and Opera at Plazza San Marco Venezia the hotel will book them for you which we found very helpfull. The only thing that got on my nerves after the fourth evening ,was the usual rose sellers who force a rose in your hand and then want you to pay for it, and the sellers of a childs catapult that shot into the air and lit up ,they are relentless they will not leave you alone while listening to the wonderful music in the square what they thought I at 50 and my mother at 70 wanted with one is beyond me. The Venician vendors, and the shops let you browse uninterupted, I also watched a great BBC dvd before I went which realy helped with telling you about the history of Venice which in turn pointed out the places of interest it is called Francesco's Venice. Venice is FANTASTIC and I would have no hesitation in stopping at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfull situation for an acceptable price”
Reviews.Author: Rui_Portimao_Portuga
Reviews.Content: A group of portuguese friends choose this hotel according to our feelings, face to some of negative coments.Clearly we have to separate comments coming from people that is constantly "at war with fellow citizans" , from the good sense ones. We found a very well placed hotel, with fantastic staff (a litle noisy in the morning, but that's italian style), with plenty and good food at breakfast, lot's of good night places where to go, and also lot's of nice spots very near, to feel the reality of Venice. All rooms are acceptable , with nice beds, and good conditions. Of course some bathrooms are tinny and others with more space, but don't deserve the severe critics I read.For the price , and face to the age of the hotel, it's a very good choice.In Venice we are there to enjoy the town and atmosphere, and not to claim about small details of the room we should use to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay at this hotel -- Dirty, Drafty & Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: cac474
Reviews.Content: My sister and I were booked at this hotel for a Saturday night stay. We arrived and immediately realized the hotel was completely misrepresented on the hotel's website as our room was nothing like the pictures. We noticed stray hairs on the bedding, paint peeling off the walls, and dirty furniture. As it was Carnivale, we knew finding another room elsewhere would be difficult but we eventually found another room in a much nicer hotel for a lower price and it was clear from our search that day that we were getting completely ripped off at the Hotel Gorizia as our decrepit room was $400 USD per night. Upon returning to the hotel to claim our things and go elsewhere, we found that there was only a security guard on-staff who claimed he didn't have access to the system and could not cancel our reservation and that we must cancel in the morning when the front desk staff returned. Knowing that we wouldn't have enough time to return before our flight the next day, we were forced to spend the night and discovered a number of additional surprises in the room. My sister's bed was stained with blood and she was forced to sleep on top of towels. The shower door was broken so that it didn't close and the bathroom was drafty. There was mold on the lampshades and dust everywhere. The doors don't lock securely as they lack a deadbolt and the hotel did not turn on the heat all night even though temperatures outside were in the 30's (farenheit). We didn't sleep at all and could not wait to leave the next morning. When we complained to the front desk staff, they said our complaints were "pure fantasy" and refused to offer us any remediation. Photos don't lie and the attached photos we took prove the decrepit condition of this hotel. Do NOT stay here. This was the worst night of our two-week trip and the experience soured our entire stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad, great loacation”
Reviews.Author: matrix1000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Hotel was easy to find. Take Ali lugana to San Marco enter the square then take a right at cafe quadri, 500m. The ride is about 1hr but if u want to go a bit faster take the Ali Luguna to Rialto. Checkin was easy. Staff spoke english and was very helpful. This hotel has a lift and we stayed on the 3 third floor. The hotel was decorated in Venetian style. The room was big and clean. I wasn't too keen on the clothlike wallpaper. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was clean and there was a powerful shower with toiletries provided. The room was nice and warm especially after walking in from 7 degrees outside. We then noticed that the room got really warm, actually hot to the point of being uncomfortable. I tried to turn the heater down but it was broken. I had no choice but to open the window which cooled the room down nicely. Breakfast was continental. Usual cheeses,ham,bread,cereals,yogurt and juices. There is lot of room and it starts from 730-1030 so quite good if u wanted to lay in a bit late. Venice is a nice city, loads to do and see and loads of places to eat. I found it difficult to choose. I ate at restaurants with pictures and with an english menu. But that was a mistake i think and they are tourist traps. The food at these places didn't taste bad but it wasn't value for money. It would have been better to eat at the true Italian restaurant. I would recommend doing all the usual sites and going up the tower as u get great views. I didn't take a Gondola ride but I think its worth it, these guys have to maneuver the boat for an hour not easy I think, when I went the lowest price was 40 Euros. I took the boat up and down the grand canal it was great, 40minutes one way. If u like soft drinks I would recommend buying them from the supermarket. Lol. On the 2nd nite, the room was getting unbearably hot again and with the window open the mosquitoes had a field day. I should have asked to move to a room where the heater wasn't broken. My partner was bitten like so many times and it made sleeping very difficult bcz of the buzzing. With the window open, its wasnt too noisy. I liked the location of this hotel, the first nite sleep was great but after that it was just too hot and the mosquitoes was bad. I am not sure what happens in the summer. The hotel had wifi but it was 8 euros for 1hr. I would recommend this hotel if the heating/ AC worked and was adjustable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: rad11
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very convenient to the Rialto and St Marks Square; however, Venice is a small enough city where most sites are pretty much within walking distance of each other. Nice and friendly staff. Good continental breakfast. Plenty of restaurants and cafes around the area. Great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Bilcalden
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is convenient to the Rialto bridge and St Marks Square, in addition to numerous restaurants. We found the staff to be helpful at the front desk and were very pleased with the breakfast room attendant and other staff members. With that being said, it should be known there is a problem with sewer gas in the second floor sitting area. The smells tend to permeate the rooms especially during the night. We left the windows open to counteract the problem but were then bothered by the late night sounds from area restaurants and live music. There was not much sleep to be had during our two night stay. Also, the overall appearance of the lobby was disapointing with soiled torn carpeting. Could definately use freshning up. We will be staying somewhere else shoud be return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: pollaqq
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed two nights at the Hotel Gorizia earlier in this month of October. The location is excellent, a few meters from the famous Piazza San Marco. The price, however, is very expensive for what it offers. The front desk staff was friendly, however, they were not very helpful when providing information. The internet is paid, which is incomprehensible. Upon arrival, the girl at reception said that the web signal could work only on the ground floor, 6 euros per hour. We made the check in and, after that, we went back to the lobby to attempt a connection. We found that for 12 euros we could have internet for 24 hours. This should have been informed. The next day we discovered that there was another operator, Swisscom, not contracted by the hotel, whose signal could be picked up on the first floor, for the same price. The rooms are very very old, which is normal considering that we are talking about Venice. But they could be better decorated. To get to the bathroom, we had to climb three steps. There was a bar nearby with loud music until late. The hallway had a very unpleasant smell, sewage-like. The breakfast is simple but satisfactory. Anyway, if we return to Venice one day, and we intend to go back, we will stay in a different hotel. For sure, there could be a better place in Venice for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “I Would Have Rated Them a "4" but...”
Reviews.Author: reh2os
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves a rating of "4" because of value and location in the Sestiere San Marco. The corner room we had on the top floor was also clean and had decent views. However, I had not seen it written anywhere (in their website or travel forums) that the lift only goes so far so we had to carry heavy luggage up another set of stairs to reach our room. We were also e-mailed poor directions so we were lost on the "wrong side" of the island and took us nearly an hour to finally find the hotel after walking up and down multiple bridges. I tried to complain but the front desk staff on duty upon check-in did not speak English. I also like to mention that this is one of those old European hotel buildings where one floor could mean going up/down half a floor with short corridors that twisted and turned into dead-ends. You eventually get used to it but when you arrive tired with luggage to haul around, it's not a fun experience. Thank goodness for the breakfast room staff for her warm service and a few tips to help us negotiate our way back to the train station on departure day. It only took us 5-7 minutes to find the vaporetto stop and we only had to climb up one small bridge. Although the breakfast was excellent, management might want to upgrade the TV size in large rooms. They're so tiny and mounted all the way up in the corner of the ceiling. I would stay here again, though, but I would know what to avoid the next time when I make reservations. There's also a very good restaurant next door. The hotel is but a short walk to San Marco Square and the Rialto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JSR16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Gorizia in early June. The hotel was a great value for the location. We had stayed at a similar hotel previously for about the same price, but the location was not good. This hotel is within a few minutes walk of St. Mark's Square and Rialto Bridge. The rooms were not huge, but for getting a good nights sleep, we had no complaints. Everything was very clean and the staff was very helpful with directions, etc. We will definitely recommend to those looking for a great value in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms and value ok, good location”
Reviews.Author: Dinoalita
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my parents. I had a single room and they had a double. If I hadnt seen their room, I probably would have given this hotel a poor review. The single rooms are VERY basic and small. Almost like a college dormitory room. I guess cant complain because they are also very inexpensive. Would be nice though if they did something with the white concrete walls or tried to decorate them a little. My parents room was very beautiful as well as most of the hotel decor. Very old Italian feel with tapestries on the walls and glass chandeliers. The breakfast room was also very pretty with good food. The location is good and central. A little hard to find at times though. The locals will help you though if you get lost. Staff was very nice and helpful! Inexpensive rooms in and expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Near the sights but outdated”
Reviews.Author: cszlaien
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very close to the sights and we actually walked from the train station to the hotel and it took around 40 min. The hotel is outdated and the AC barely worked and it was noisy. The room was actually quite large and had 3 beds and the bathroom was a decent size. We were only there for 1 night so it wasnt too bad. I would recommend that people take water bus #1 from the train station. This goes along the grand canal to st. marks square and you get the same views of a gondola ride without the heavy price tag (80E),

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location - good value”
Reviews.Author: yanklovesanaussie
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights and prepaid. worth the $$. Air conditioning was not great and it was pretty hot out, but cooled down at night. very quiet and a good night's sleep. close to rialto and st marks square - really close, like 2 minutes in either direction. could not have picked a better location if we knew what we were doing, which we did not.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Precy”
Reviews.Author: chiquibabe
Reviews.Content: I have nothing bad to say about this hotel maybe that it was far to get to. We had to drag our bags, but we knew, so we got good bags. The rooms were roomy and the staff was great. Breakfast was good also. I think it was kind of pricey for the location, and rooms. Venice is a fantastic place but pretty expensive more than Nice was.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: graceoliver
Reviews.Content: This was a charming hotel. It met all of our requirements, the rooms were large enough, we spent very little time in our rooms, it was clean, the beds were very comfortable. We had a nice bathroom with a tub and a hand held shower. Our friends had a tiny shower....so it is the luck of the draw on that one. The staff was friendly and helpful, they even booked a tour for us. The little wine bar next door was our favorite place of all....we discovered it on our first day...and we were regulars. We were able to roll our suitcases from the water bus from the airport right to the hotel, and we were in a perfect spot to explore Venice. We thought it was quite reasonable for Venice. Also it did have an elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic position - but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: VMTraveller
Reviews.Content: Tremendous location to stay. Really friendly staff especially in Reception. Breakfast unexciting but that's normal in Italy. Bathroom & bed very comfortable (very good nights' sleep) but room very small.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: sukarki2003
Reviews.Content: I had read good reviews about this hotel as I wanted a hotel that was central , comfortable but value for money - and this certainly ticked all the boxes from our perspective. Room was absolutely fine- clean,and comfortable - the hotel was in a superb location a few minutes from the square and Rialto bridge. It was our first time in Venice but we decided to get to the island via the bus from Marco Polo which only cost 2.5 euros each which took c35 mins. It was then about 30 mins walk from Piazza Roma and thought it was a great way to find your way around (wouldn't recommend this if you have lots of luggage though as there are lots of little bridges to go through!)

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in Venise”
Reviews.Author: 1planete
Reviews.Content: We spent one of our best holiday , clean comfortable bedroom, very nice staff, right close to St.Marco and Rialto,a plentful breakfast , we recommend it to everybodyThanks indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: fcsklabrie
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel close to a lot of things. 25 min walk to train station, 5 min walk to Rialto, 5 min walk to Piazza San Marco. We were assigned room #22 which is the handicapped room - a big room because of big bathroom. There was a constant musky smell in hotel and room...never could find out what it was. Decent staff, excellent breakfast, safe in room, fridge, expensive wi-fi (go to McDonalds for free). Might be a bit noisy depending on your room as it's above and next to bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem hidden away, fantastic location,”
Reviews.Author: tdangel
Reviews.Content: As a first time lone traveller, this hotel was ideal, staff were very helpful and friendly. Only a few minutes walk from St.marks square and all it has to offer. It is very easy to walk all around Venice, once you have found you bearings and got a map, just go of and explore. The bar next door was also very welcoming and entertaining, very good live band on the night I was there, and owner very amusing, felt very safe. Easiest way to find hotel is to take the water bus from airport, 13 euros, a bit steep but it lets you off at the Rialto bridge stop, exactly at the narrow alley with a large floor tile advertising carbonera restaurant, this is called Bembo which leads into Calle del Fabbri , take this alley and just continue walking for about 3mins, hotel on left hand side just past sweet shop with huge chuppa chup lollies in the window. I got lost a couple of times and every single person I asked helped me and it didn't seem like a bother to them, You can take a bus from the station for 2.50 euros back to the airport once you know where to go, if you are reasonably fit, and do not have too much luggage to carry as it is about a 30min walk over many bridges. The hotel breakfast was usual continental, plenty of choice, served in nice breakfast room. Don't be put of by the carpets which have seen better days, the rooms and bathrooms were clean and bedding and towels spotlessly white. I would certainly recommend this hotel and would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Best attribute is location”
Reviews.Author: europearoundtheworld
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located a short walk between San Marco and Rialto. Great for first time visitors to Venice. Easy to arrive by traghetto (boat) from train station / only 2 stops away) though the boat costs are very high these days!! But worth it if you are carrying luggage or in a hurry. ... Hotel is recently renovated and top floor rooms are quite spacious and modern for Venice hotels. Still a bit pricey -- but so is all of Venice. Near to many restaurants, cafes, shops, gondola stops, etc. Carpet in hotel could be replaced... and breakfast room expanded a bit.. but overall good, comfortable place to stay. There will always be mosquitos and you will need warm pajamas any time of year as the nights can be chilly and humid. Most of the reception staff is kind, speaks many languages, but one female staff member at the front desk is not very patient or welcoming. The maids and breafast staff are friendly and hardworking... the breakfast amount and quality are sufficient and better than most Italian hotels (I have traveled and lived around Italy for over 20 years). Overall decent quality. I would recommend and return to this hotel. Good for romantic getaway, family trip, fine for young children and people of all ages and backgrounds.

Reviews.Title: “A gem! fantastic location and La Valigia Bar next door a star find!!!”
Reviews.Author: EdinburghPigeons
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel but expensive but hey it is Venice, perfect location 5mins walk from Rialto and St Mark's Square, very clean and friendly hotel staff. The Bar ajoining the hotel (La Valigia) was the main star ,welcoming and fun. Good food and tapas (Chicetti ) and frequented by locals. Tips: try the Spritze drink (whitewine, Apersol and soda) looks like Irn Bru all the locals drink it. Thrown your maps away and just wander ,we found a fantastic restaurant, part of of the Iris hotel on the bank on a little canal. Keep away from St Marks Square too expensive to drink or eat.

Reviews.Title: “clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: zaraCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Good location. If you stay here - the closest spot from the airport, if you take a water bus is Rialto and not st. marks square as is on the website. If you stop at rialto there are no stairs to navigate with your luggage. Breakfast is decent, staff are cordial.

Reviews.Title: “um ok.”
Reviews.Author: isabella9207
Reviews.Content: If you have last minute plans and aren't staying for too long, it's fine. Otherwise, do spend the extra $50-$100 and stay somewhere nicer/cleaner and just better. The location was perfect, the only thing that you can't complain about but the room was a little eh...the bathroom was clean sort of but the shower situation was not so great and a little not so clean. I would recommend this hotel if you have no choice are just trying to save a few buck and aren't really going to be in the room. It's ok but venice is expensive so you might have to compromise to save a few bucks and still have easy access to the major attractions. We paid about $260/night.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: littlemissperfection
Reviews.Content: Want somewhere very reasonably priced to stay, which has a great location in between San Marco and Rialto (5 minutes walking distance either way), on a lovely typical narrow winding Venetian alley, which is clean, with friendly staff, small but adequate rooms with TV, reasonably priced mini-bar and air-conditiong..? Then come to Gorizia a la Valigia. Had a 4 day stay and absolutely loved every minute of it. My boyfriend and I never made it up in time before breakfast so I can't comment on this (we were too busy catching up on lost sleep from the night before!) The weather was perfect (24 degrees in October!), Venice was beautiful and the hotel's location topped it off. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Please dont take this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssharna
Reviews.Content: its not even a three star hotel. We asked for an Iron, guess what..it was in the common area, they couldn't bring it to you. When we went to use it, it didnt even work. If you are paying more the $75 for this hotel, you are making a mistake. We get in, they tell us that our room is wrong, which I was happy about as we had a small room. Second room we got, the AC didnt work. They changed our room again, third room's AC was to loud that we ended up turning it off. So, please do yourself a favor book someother hotel then this.

Reviews.Title: “Really good. Recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Antonio-ASJR
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location. If you are arriving from the airport or Rome Square, take the "vaporeto" number 1 and you will be a couple of blocks away from the hotel with no steps to cross. It is a couple of blocks from the main sqaure also (San Pietro) where you should go at night to check the claThe rooms are nice and the breakfast is ok. Staff is GREAT! Really kind and helpful, cant complaint of a single thing. Visited a couple of other hotels in Venice and, if you want to save a few bucks, this is your place. Although it is not cheap compared to the rest of the world, keep in mind that you are in Venice, and everything here is expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place and a great hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: spaces2603
Reviews.Content: We were very happy we chose this hotel for various reasons. The locality could not be better - its within reach of most of the best tourist attracions. The room and furniture were a bit small but beautifully decorated and the bathroom was very decent with all the modern necessities. Considering that the breakfast was included in the price, it was excellent. Great variety to choose from and all the fruit, cereals, bread, croissants, ham and all that was served were always VERY fresh. The waitress was always very busy replenishing the trays of food. With regards to cleanliness, we definitely cannot criticize because the room was always very clean, while the bed linen and towels were always freshly laundered. Definitely one of the best hotels in Venice with the best rates offered in a very central location! We highly recommend it and adivse to check on this hotel if you're visiting Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Magial Carnavale Experience Made BETTER!”
Reviews.Author: dlonyc
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed 2 nights in Gorizia a la Valigia during Carnavale in February, and I cannot imagine how we could possibly have had a better stay. The location is AMAZING -- especially for the price. The room, though certainly not fancy, was perfectly reasonably sized (especially for Venice, from what I understand). The breakfasts featured plenty of great choices and a cheerful facility, and the hotel in general was adorably decorated for the festival with paper chains and other fun adornments, which made it all even more fun and whimsical. And best of all -- the staff was absolutely INCREDIBLE. In particular, Mario and Patrizia took care of us like we were family, all the while entertaining us thoroughly with their hilarious banter (in Italian, which we don't even speak!). I honestly would have paid far more just for the attention and kindness they paid us. Even after we left, the fantastic service of La Gorizia continued. In a rush to make our plane, I left my favorite boots in our room. When I got home, I emailed the hotel to ask if they had been found, and they were absolutely wonderful about getting back to me and working with me to get them back to me. I now think of them and my stay at this marvelous hotel every time I wear them! Thank you, Mario, Patrizia and everyone at La Gorizia -- hopefully, we will see you all again SOON!

Reviews.Title: “The concierg is unpollite and the hotel is no good”
Reviews.Author: viajjante
Reviews.Content: My room "superior" was with a very little balcony to a dirty view. The berakfast was regular. The fat desk man for attend the guest was unpollite. Dont stay there, bad rate cost/bennefit.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Room 58”
Reviews.Author: swardDublin_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in May, 2009. Great location, pleasant dining room, excellent breakfast and the shower unit had, unusually for a hotel of this sandard, a proper power shower. But what abour Room 58? One realises that one gets what one pays for but to describe it as a Superior Double was a serious abuse of language. It had the appearance and lay-out of a converted corridor. One shdders to think what the lesser Classic Rooms were like.

Reviews.Title: “Awful...you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Jeff31572
Reviews.Content: On the positive side...a great location...THAT"S ALL. Threadbare, tired, depressing, and minuscule rooms, not a drawer or cabinet to put any thing in. If you were lucky you packed only hanging things, Furniture chipped all over,. Rooms so small that there was 18" between the wall and foot of the bed....and we paid for the big room. If you want low cost this is the place...but do not expect anything else....think one step above a Hostel. Did not stay long enough to find out about the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Phil_on_holiday
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great value for money and in a great location. I agree with all positive reviews of this hotel. It is in a great location, very clean, hotel staff polite and helpful. Would definately stay again. The only thing I would say is that the resturants in the immeadiate vacinity are quite expensive but very good. If you don't mind a walk to the Pizzale Roma area the restuarants are cheaper and just as good.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: ooky84
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great value for money. There are 3 floors of rooms and we stayed on the top floor - we didn't have much of a view except for other rooftops, but the hotel is not located on a canal, so I doubt any of the rooms do. The hotel couldn't be much better located - it is a 5 minute walk (if that) to get to the Rialto Bridge in one direction and St Mark's Square in the other. This also makes it convenient for catching the vaporetto (water bus) service. The staff are very friendly - the reception desk staff helped us with directions, gave us maps, advised on travel prices and times and were generally chatty speaking very good English. The rooms are nicely decorated and the beds are firm and comfortable. The pillows we had were like concrete though and I ended up using a folded blanket to sleep on. We had a wet room style bathroom which seems great as it feels bigger, but everything does get soaked, so put your toilet paper in the bedroom when you shower! My main complaint with the hotel would be the bathroom smelled of sewerage every morning. After they cleaned it and all day/evening it would be fine, but in the morning it was unbearable. Friends in the next room to ours had no problem. Lucky us! The breakfast was really good for a continental one - there were croissants, about 6 types of bread, butter, cheeses, meats, cereal, muesli, jams, yoghurts and lots of fresh fruit. One tip to save some money: In Venice, drink water and don't touch the bread! Drinks were about 5 euros (even for a coke) whereas water was usually about 2 euros. They put a basket of bread and breadsticks out on the table wherever you go, but if no one eats any they don't charge you for it. If you take even one piece out you are charged and it ranged from about 6 to 10 euros for 4 of us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good breakfast, that might be it.”
Reviews.Author: mjl1979
Reviews.Content: One thing's for sure, the location was GREAT. Fairly near St. Mark's Square (which is beautiful) and pretty centrally located to the Rialto Bridge and other things you might want to check out. I loved Venice very much. Another good thing was that the breakfast was pretty good for what it was. Basic breads, coffee, hams, and little treats. I'm not that picky of an eater.. but my wife seemed pretty okay with what they had to offer. The room was TINY. THis was the first leg of our trip so I guess I expected it to be a lot smaller. We felt like we were in a little box, but at the same time, it was quaint and since we were so happy to be in Italy, it was okay with us. Not sure if we would have felt the same way if it was the last leg of our trip. Most of the staff was pretty friendly, but there was this one guy we called "Mr. Grump." At this hotel, you have to give your key to the front desk every time you leave and sometimes he'd be on the phone or browsing the internet and not give us a chance for him to give or take our key. It drove us crazy because he could see us standing there and he would glance over then ignore us. I think one time we waited 5 minutes (which is a LONG time when you are staring at him chit chatting on the phone). Anyhow, I didn't pay all that money to be treated like a pain in the butt. Too bad. Probably not a great place to stay if you are big on service.

Reviews.Title: “Love The Location”
Reviews.Author: Emeran
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on the reviews from this site and was not disappointed. The location cannot be beat and the hotel was quiet, clean with a very nice breakfast. We had six of us in our party and it could not have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location - not luxury”
Reviews.Author: Faerfoxe
Reviews.Content: This is a late review, we stayed here in April 2006 for our 4 day honeymoon. We chose this hotel because we wanted in central location in Venice, reasonably decent without breaking the bank. This hotel fitted the bil nicely, the rooms were clean and fairly comfortable, though in retrospect I'm not sure I'd bother with a premium room again as it didn't look too much better than the normal rooms (took a sneaky peek when the cleaning lady left a door open!). The breakfast was fine, continental and plenty of it (no fruit though) and the coffee was very good. The staff were polite and efficient, though a little stand-offish. We did have one incident where they knocked the door at 3pm in the afternoon despite the "do not disturb" sign. When they didn't get a reply (it was our honeymoon...) they phoned and asked us to leave the room as a maintenance man needed to deal with the bathroom. Apparently the fact that our bath wasn't sealed properly meant that water was sporadically leaking into a room below - though not at that precise moment, I hasten to add. I told the lady that they'd have to give me us twenty minutes to freshen up, but she seemed quite cross that the guy was to be kept waiting. I think this should have been arranged with us in advance, we wouldn't have minded at all with a bit of forewarning, but it did seem a little harsh to be kicked out with no notice. Despite this, the good features outweighed the bad - this is not a place to go to be spoiled and pampered, but it is a good value hotel in a fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Great Room”
Reviews.Author: 1crew_hss
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my fiancÃ©e and had a wonderful time. I must say the previous reviews go a bit far in terms of negativity - from what I researched before we travelled was that there are some poor standard rooms but I can say the room and service we experienced was excellent and truly Italian. The staff were very friendly including "Stafano" at the front desk. We requested by email, prior to travel, for a good room and certainly got one. We had a lovely Venetian style room, champagne bottle to welcome us, our very own sun terrace and a view of the main tower in Venice! Location was excellent, one side very close was the Rialto bridge and the other was San Marco Piazza a short 10 min walk away. I've been to a few cities but must say that our stay in Venice was the most romantic of them all. Very recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: karasirenetta
Reviews.Content: If I could this hotel ZERO stars, I would. I am a single female and stayed here while traveling alone last year. One of the men who manned the front desk -- Stefano -- was an extremely disturbed, psychotic person who stalked me, knocked on my door repeatedly, and when I wouldn't answer, kept calling the phone in my room. I was too scared to sleep here alone at night because there are NO interior deadbolts to the rooms -- just an old-fashioned key. I had to sneak out of the hotel with my bag and check into another hotel even though my stay was fully prepaid through Expedia. When I called the next day to complain, the other front desk people refused to do anything about either Stefano or my prepaid reservation. DO NOT STAY HERE if female and traveling alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position”
Reviews.Author: SightseerKent
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel - fairly small room but nicely furnished with chandelier and nice wardrobe etc; spacious enough for two. Best thing about it was the placement - very easy to find when we arrived in Venice late at night, get off at Rialto and follow the map on the website. Friendly check in and 24 hr reception. Didn't try the breakfast but just looked like the usual continental one. A minutes walk to St Marks Square or Rialto Bridge so you are right in the heart of Venice which is great considering it is one of the cheaper hotels to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in San Marco”
Reviews.Author: dbgjtc
Reviews.Content: As others have said, good location. An easy walk to the Rialto Bridge and Saint Marks Square. Hotel staff friendly. Our room was pleasant. Only problem was not much space to hang or put away clothes. An armoire with a half-dozen hangers and one drawer. We had to leave most of our clothes in our suitcase. Clean bathroom, but the shower is small. I'm 6'3 and had a hard time maneuvering. No tray or anything to put the soap on. We had no problem with flooding as others did. The continental breakfast is good, but no fresh fruit or eggs. The Rialto market is a 10 minute walk away. Go there and get fruit at a good price. I'm baffled by the previous reviewer who complained of an unfriendly staff. Same with the smell of urine. We found the halls very clean and both the day and night desk people polite and genuinely caring. As for restaurants, the biggest surprise is that so many of them serve pizza. And if you order a glass of wine or beer they give you a small bowl of potato chips. For every round, more potato chips. Seafood is the big thing in most restaurants and, of course, pasta. Veal seems to be more popular than beef. If you're on a budget there's something to be said for the Tourist Menus. Most restaurants have a cover charge just to sit down. And the better places have a cover charge and tip included with the bill. Places who don't have a cover charge advertise this. It can be as high as 3 Euros per person. Definitely check out The Lido. We didn't know much about it, but when we got there (a 10-minute vaporetto ride) we found it breathtaking. No canals. Cars. You get off at the dock and walk straight down the main street (or take a bus) and after 10 minutes you're at a beautiful beach and the Adriatic Sea. If you have a good map and comfortable shoes, you can explore all of Venice on foot. It's not as big as it seems. We thought we'd be jumping on and off vaporettos and we didn't take one. The Gondola rides are tricky. The cost can be 80-120 Euros (music is extra, so is a night ride). The gondoleers are more like carnival hucksters trying to lure customers. Some are charming and funny, others have attitudes. However, at about 8 locations on the Grand Canal there are stops called tragettos where gondolas will take you across the canal for 1 Euro. It's a 2-minute ride and fun. These are there if you need to get across the canal and you're too far from a bridge

Reviews.Title: “Not the Most beautiful Hotel on the Street, but Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: luvs2go
Reviews.Content: With the Dollar down in the dumps, we looked for a hotel under $400/night. This was challenging. This hotel fit the bill but when we approached it, we passed all the charming ones to come to Gorizia which is plain and old, but clean and not shoddy. We soon found out the staff were very friendly and helpful in every way with restaurants, taxis, and special needs. The room was simple but it had all the basics and the bed was fine. The bathroom was OK except there was no shower curtain. Yes, I know we Americans are spoiled, but we are what we are! And there appeared to have been one, but it was cut away. So the floor got flooded every time we showered. Fortunately they supplied plenty of (worn) towels so the floor was easily mopped up. I'm not sure I would run back to this hotel... Venice, yes!

Reviews.Title: “breakfast”
Reviews.Author: marcoUk
Reviews.Content: Service .. Fantastic Breakfast ... superb.. strong coffee, plenty of cold meat to choose from, fresh bread, a choice of croissents, Could not be better .. clean towels EVERY day ... Staff .. as one would expect from any hotel , VERY helpful.. Go again ... a very big YES !!!! Recommend to any one who wants 5star service in a 3star hotel !!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: daisymai_8
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from staying at this hotel and I have never before felt I should write a review but this hotel could not be faulted. Its position was close to st Marks and Rialto bridge but down a quiet street. so was ideal. The decor was totally in keeping with Venice and the whole hotel was spotlessly clean. I would definately recommend this to anyone who wants a smallish Venetian style hotel

Reviews.Title: “Gorizia, great location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: jacksocket
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Venice was in Aug 2007, so I thought it about time to jot some information down about this hotel Iâ€™d originally found using Trip Advisor. Hotel Gorizia wasnâ€™t the top hotel in the ratings, but any bad comments it had seemed quite trivial. As it turned out it was ideally sited, probably 10min walk from St Marcoâ€™s Square. I had looked at hotels on the main-land and on the spit of land called The Lido, intending to travel into Venice for days out, but that would have been a bad, bad mistake as we would have missed out on the night life and spent an awful lot of time on water busses. ( more about water busses later). So location is excellent. Its looks were deceptive, not a very imposing reception area but the bedroom was very Venation â€˜oldâ€™ style and had everything you need for a weekend stay. The window view wasnâ€™t great, but then we didnâ€™t intend to experience Venice through a window, you can do that at home watching travel programs on TV. My only real gripe would be the wet room shower in the bathroom, where the floor gets completely soaked unless you position towels around the base to hold in the flood! Tip No.1 ! The breakfast was of typical continental style â€“ ham, cheese , bread etc.. etc but was of good standard and sufficient for us. The people on the desk were genuinely helpful and spoke some English â€“ however I find you will always get a better service if you learn some â€˜please / thank-youâ€™ phrases in the native tongueâ€¦ and of course it makes it more fun. I had a bag lost on the flight in from Schiphol, it didnâ€™t appear on the baggage carousel, there were lots of other disappointed travellers that day too. But (Tip No.2 ) we had â€˜cross packedâ€™ our bags so I was not completely without a change of clothes. Indeed if you do lose a bag, always get a form from the airport the form stating when/ where / times etc as you will find the insurance folk will want this â€“ I didnâ€™tâ€¦ but we all learn this way. The hotel desk staff insisted on making a call to the airport to chase up my lost bag, , so they were keen to correct this failure. So plus points for the hotel on this one. We opted to collect the bag from the airport when it arrived from Brussels or somewhere â€“ but this potentially wasted half a day on those noisy & hot water busses (this was Aug, so hot anyway). We probably should have trusted the Italian delivery service and requested delivery to the hotel â€“ but at the time I wasnâ€™t convinced. The staff also pointed us in the right direction to book a night out at the theatre and advised about good restaurants. On the basis of this stay Iâ€™d use it again and could recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: UkJill
Reviews.Content: Everything about the hotel was brilliant. Fantastic location, good breakfast, and pleasant staff - what more do you need when enjoying a short break to a beautiful city like Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krantic
Reviews.Content: The Gorizia hotel is a nice hotel on San Marco in Venice - close to both Piazza San Marco as well as Rialto the location is very convenient for sight seeing as well as transfers to the station and beyond. The hotel in itself is nothing outstanding - nicely appointed rooms, clean bathrooms and pleasant staff - all in all a good hotel for a couple of nights stay if you plan to stay out most of the time. The continental breakfast is decent with some choice in terms of breads and cold cuts but not much more.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny”
Reviews.Author: Cotta
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with our Venice hotel selection. The staff was genial and the location, about half way between the Grand Canal and St Marks, can't be beat. Unlike other reviewers our room, even by American standards, was large and so was the bathroom. The decor was a little unusual, sort of baroque, meets art deco with a touch of hunting lodge. If we do return to Venice we would consider using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: CdnTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location near St Mark's Square and within walking distance of much of the highlights. If you keep in mind that all hotels in Venice are quite small, this is a pretty good hotel. The room we had was nice enough, well appointed but very small. Thankfully we paid for a room with A/C - there isn't much air to be had otherwise. There is no room service really to speak (we sent the staff into a panic just looking for ice for champagne) but the service is good at the front desk and they were very helpful. The breakfast is a small basic buffet. All in all, an OK hotel - no complaints about the amenities or staff, but would have preferred a hotel with restaurant or even bar to chill out in. Also, bear in mind that it is a long walk to the vaporetto over many bridges so bring small, portable luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable & Good lacation”
Reviews.Author: LovetheDrake
Reviews.Content: This was a perfectly nice hotel. We were able to get a family room which was great since we were over budget. There was a continental breakfast, nothing fancy, but it was o.k. The location was really good. A tip for getting there, take the vaperetto that goes to the Rialto, not St. Marco's. We made the mistake of assuming that because the description on the wesite talked about its proximity to St. Marco that it would make sense to take the St. Marco water bus, not so. We spent two nights there and they were having some trouble with the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Very well looked after”
Reviews.Author: 40_yr_old_lady
Reviews.Content: Stayed in April 07 for 3 nights. Arrived and was allowed to check in early. Grabbed a shower. However, there was a genuine problem with the shower and they gave me a call. As its your 40th birthday tomorrow they said we will upgrade you to the best room in the house. They were so helpful and dealt with the inconvenience very efficiently and were really nice. Also, on the evening of my birthday they gave me a lovely surprise and left a bottle of bubbly and 2 champagne glasses - perfect. Also, the location of the hotel was great, only 5 mins to either Rialto Bridge or San Marco square. My husband and I had a super time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RaphJ
Reviews.Content: This was a really pleasant experience for us. The hotel was welcoming, the staff pleasant, the room excellent (comfortable bed, large bathroom, small balcony), everything was ultra clean (sheets and towels changed daily), the position couldn't have been bettered, breakfast (included) was above average and above all the hotel was very quiet. All this at a very reasonable price - obviously prices vary according to the time of year. Unlike some hotels we have stayed in (Hotel ITC in Amsterdam for example) this one lived up to its web site photographs. We will certainly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chick96
Reviews.Content: I was worried about staying at this hotel after some of the reviews I had read however I shouldn't have. The hotel has one of the best locations, hidden down a side road just off St Marks Square with the Rialto bridge about 5 minutes away. We stayed in a Superior Double room and it was very spacious with a lovely big bathroom. It was very clean and quiet (which is surprising considering you're in the centre of Venice) and the staff were very friendly. We only had breakfast once in the hotel - it was ok - croissants, yoghuts etc but I would recommend trying some of the local cafes. If you're looking for a stylish, modern hotel then it's probably not for you but if you want a typical Venetian hotel with a fantastic location then this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Gorizia”
Reviews.Author: Dancemania
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner just spent a couple of days in Venice at the Hotel Gorizia. Originally we were booked into another hotel but changed at the last minute to the Hotel Gorizia after doing a lot more research and reading of reviews and the hotel did not disappoint. Having looked at the photos of the hotel I didn't expect my room to actually look like it did in the photos because sometimes hotels slightly glorify their rooms but our room did and the room was large and comfortable and most importantly - clean. The bathroom too was of a good size and had a nice hot shower and plenty of fresh towels. Incidentally we stayed in room 51. The staff were very nice and helpful and it was very pleasant. Breakfast consisted of croissants, bread, rolls, yoghurts and tea and coffee and juices. It was served in a lovely breakfast room and was just right for what we needed to start the day with. The hotel itself was within minutes of San Marco square and proved an ideal location for getting about. I saw some of the other rooms whilst walking through one day and all the ones I saw looked very nice and as they did in the photos. I gave this hotel 4 out of 5. 4 is supposed to be "above average" but this hotel for me was really really good and a lot higher than above average. The Hotel was clean, staff were polite, rooms were a good size and smart, breakfast was good and the hotel was located within minutes of San Marco square. I think for the price that this hotel is good value for money. Venice was great and two days there seemed to be plenty. The food though was pretty terrible and very expensive. I had two of the worst meals ever in Venice and ironically the Macdonalds I briefly had was the best meal I ate there!!! On my last night I went to the Restaurant Pizza and Pasta de Celio. I really would avoid this place, we had 2 cokes that were like soda stream coke that came to 10 Euros and the night before our wine was cheaper than that. Plus we had two pizzas which were tiny and wafer thin which meant we had to go for another meal afterwards just to fill up after a long day and the meal came to 40 euros which for what we got was very over priced. Really wouldn't recommend going there because it was basically a rip off. It seems though that a lot of the restaurants in Venice are not very good so hunt around but it may make no diference. Being a gay couple the hotel as well was "gay-friendly" in that respect. If I was to return to Venice I would return to the Hotel Gorizia.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the price - I'd stay again...and again”
Reviews.Author: roguemh
Reviews.Content: Gorizia a la Valigia. The name alone inspires. This clean and cozy hotel played a leading role in my trip to Venice. After a long day of walking in the 90 + degree heat, getting lost in the winding streets and elbowing tourists for a view of a famous piazza, returning to a la Valigia felt like returning home (except I was still in one of the most beautiful cities in the world!). Here are the highlights: (1) Location - can't beat it. As soon as I walked out the door I could take a left and walk to Piazza di San Marco in 10 minutes or hang a right and end up in Rialto in 15. And I loved every step of the way in either direction. (2) Adorable rooms. I lucked out with a queen sized bed with plenty of floor space, but what really captured my imagination was the antique-style Venetian furniture including an ornate headboard, armoire and writing desk. (3) Top notch service. The staff was polite (certainly not overly effusive which works for me) and as a woman traveling alone, I appreciated their custom of taking my key as a left the Hotel and having a doorman ready 24/7 to let me back in. There were a few minor details that cast a slight shadow over my stay. The one small window in my room faced a stucco wall. The lobby was restrained to say the least, but that is to be expected of smaller hotels. The continental breakfast was unimpressive, but the 10 pounds I lost during my short stay more than made up for it's poor performance. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel for anyone seeking an affordable option and would stay there again if I wasn't driven by the need to patronize nearly every hotel on the planet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: 032610b
Reviews.Content: We based our decision to stay here on the reviews from tripadvisor and we weren't disappointed. The hotel is about 500 yards from San Marco Sq and 300 yards to Rialto Bridge - Perfect location for seeing the sights - the room was small but clean & tidy, with nice decoration and breakfast was simple and perfect for starting a day of wandering the streets. Highly recommended - good value for money (we paid Â£67 per night!) especially considering the location.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay at the Hotel Gorizia again”
Reviews.Author: AKACohen
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice at night after traveling all day only to be told that our reserved room at the Locanda Antica Venezia (which was very highly recommeded on Trip Advisor) was not available and we were taken to a shabby and dirty hotel as a substitute. Unhappy about the situation, my husband and I walked down the street and happened upon the bright lights of the Hotel Gorizia lobby. The reception staff were able to get us a room for three nights. Although we were charged almost double for one of the nights, the price for the two other nights was very reasonable for a large, quiet and nicely decorated room. The breakfasts were plentiful and the hotel's location (almost midway between the Rialto Bridge and St. Mark's Square) was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Rich-in-the-sun
Reviews.Content: Excellent location between Rialto and St Marks. Would be ideal for weekend break. Very good restaurant 25 metres away, turn left out of front door, over bridge on left. We stayed for 1 night pre cruise. Only negative is the hotel is NOT on a canal so there is a 100 metre walk from water taxi (a bit of a pain with large cases) but 'do-able'.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: barow44
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, right off St. Marks, close to vaporetto's and right among the most expensive hotels. Room was small but nice and clean. Staff was mixed - nice when we arrived in daytime but kind of useless and unfriendly at night. Restaurant is a joke but Venice has 1000's to choose from anyway. Overall good value for Venice - I'm sure there are many nicer places but probably not for less than E250/night.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location of the Gorizia a la Valigia”
Reviews.Author: teress
Reviews.Content: We needed two rooms to accommodate my family of four. The hotel is ideally located near St. Mark's Square, and we enjoyed our trip to Venice immensely. The hotel staff was very helpful with directions and any requests that we had. It is also close to some small restaurants with excellent food. The hotel is not on a canal, but very close to a point where the water boat delivers and picks up passengers. This is an important point if you have luggage!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - close to St.Marks Square, restaurants, water taxis. Staff were very friendly. The room was fairly small, but great for what you need. The continental breakfast is adequate, but not very exciting. I would definitely recommend this hotel to a friend. You need to be careful of the restaurants on the side streets directly off the square, the food is average and the service not much better. If you try to query anything, they get quite hostile. Just go one street back and the restaurants are so much better. Although the bars are great fun on the square at night, especially when the bands are playing.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: Liz13
Reviews.Content: Having just spent five nights at this hotel, we can whole-heartedly recommend it. The rooms are beautiful, spotlessly clean, and with mini-bar fridges and air-conditioning. The staff were friendly and helpful (one of our bags did not arrive at the airport!). They helped negotiate the 'Lost baggage' procedure. Breakfast is splendid for the price and again the staff were efficient and courteous. The location is ideal for exploring the city, whether that be on foot or by vaporetto. But we found that walking everywhere allowed us to see amazing buildings and visit churches we would not have come across if we only used the boats.

Reviews.Title: “Gorizia --perfect location”
Reviews.Author: izzywizzy
Reviews.Content: Arrived in St Marks mid afternoon in the middle of carnival(not a good idea--soooo busy).got to hotel and man at reception didn't look too happy to see us(maybe he had a bad day),taken to our room(no 49),what a great room,not big but plenty of room for us,bathroom was a good size too but the shower curtain had been taken down so when you showered the floor ended up in puddles. breakfast was continental,was ok but could have done with some fruit. next morning realised we'd forgotten the plug adaptor so asked at reception where we could get one.they then looked around hotel until they found one for us so we didn't have to go and buy one(have to say it was grumpy man that did this for us and he was much happier and helpful). the hotel is in a great location,perfect,we'd stay there again if we go back to Venice. As a treat go to Florian's for afternoon tea(48euros for 2)it was yummy.

HotelInfo.Name: Gorizia a la Valigia
HotelInfo.Address: Calle dei Fabbri 4696-A | San Marco, 30124 Venice, Italy
